From the words lettered A to D, choose the word that best completes each of the following sentences:
All we need...............dedicated teachers
explanation:
When all as a word means 'everything', a singular verb is used; but when it means a collection of people or things, a plural verb is used.
Examples:
All has been set for the final match. (Here ALL means everything)
All have left the stadium. (Here ALL means a collection of people)
The subject "All we need" is treated as a singular entity because of the indefinite pronoun "all", and the verb should agree with this singular subject. Therefore, "is" (singular) is the appropriate choice. Options A and D use plural verbs ("are" and "were"), and option B uses the past tense singular verb "was," none of which correctly matches the singular subject.
